    • Method Detail

      • randomPassword

        public static java.lang.String randomPassword()
        Generates a random password that has got three capital letters, two digits (according to the acceptance criteria), f. The password does not have any type of format, because the position of the characters is always randomized. Returns the generated password.
        Returns:
        Password with random format.

      • setCapitalLetters

        public static java.lang.String setCapitalLetters()
        Returns three capital letters that will make part of the randomized password.
        Returns:
        three random capital letters.

      • setLowerCaseLetters

        public static java.lang.String setLowerCaseLetters()
        Returns five lower case letters that will make part of the randomized password.
        Returns:
        five random lower case letters.

      • setNumbers

        public static java.lang.String setNumbers()
        Returns two random natural numbers (contained in the interval [0;9]) that make part of the randomized password.
        Returns:
        two random natural numbers (contained in the interval [0;9]).

      • setNormalPassword

        private static java.lang.String setNormalPassword​(java.lang.String capitalLetters,
                                                  java.lang.String lowerCaseLetters,
                                                  java.lang.String numbers)
        Returns a password in the format CClllllnn (C: Capital Letters; l: lower case letters; n: numbers).
        Parameters:
        capitalLetters - Random Capital Letters.
        lowerCaseLetters - Random Lower Case Letters.
        numbers - Random Natural Numbers (contained in the interval [0;9]).
        Returns:
        Password in the format CClllllnn.

      • setRandomPassword

        public static java.lang.String setRandomPassword​(java.lang.String normalPassword)
        Randomizes the position of the characters of the password (in the format CClllllnn).
        Parameters:
        normalPassword - Password in the format CClllllnn.
        Returns:
        Randomized password.

      • containsNumber

        public static boolean containsNumber​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> positions,
                                     int position)
        Allows to verify if a character position of the password is already occupied.
        Parameters:
        positions - List that contains all of the character positions in use of the randomized password.
        position - Position to be checked.
        Returns:
        Boolean value according to if the position is on the List or not.
